what: Choose which preferences to include in the snapshot
title: Manage and Sync Your RStudio Preferences
text: Snapshots don’t need include every preference RStudio. Instead, can use snapshot store specific groups preferences. three arguments control preferences included: include: Names RStudio preferences include. provided, preferences included. exclude: Names RStudio preferences exclude snapshot. source: source current preference value. Preferences set different levels, lowest highest precedence: "default" RStudio’s built-defaults "computed" detected supplied external sources, e.g. path git system "system" derived system-wide rstudio-prefs.json "user" set user sessions (global options) "project" set current project session default "user", since preferences ’ve intentionally set IDE. Also, "project" preferences already stored .Rproj file. example, store favorite pane layout "favorite_panes":
code: snapshot_prefs_save(   name = "favorite_panes",   path = tmp_snap,   include = "panes" ) #> ℹ Writing snapshot favorite_panes to 'tmp_snap.json'✓ Writing snapshot favorite_panes to 'tmp_snap.json' ... done  snapshot_prefs_use(   name = "favorite_panes",   path = tmp_snap,   preview = TRUE ) #> <snapshot "favorite_panes"> #> panes: {"quadrants":["Source","TabSet1","Console","TabSet2"],"tabSet1":["History","Connections","Packages","Presentatio…
